pull.title: Fail AppInitMain if either disk space check fails

rename.from: Fail if either disk space check fails
rename.to: Fail AppInitMain if either disk space check fails

events.body: I think it's reasonable to split the expression to log which directory needs more space.
Agree with @promag: while we're in the neighborhood, we should specify which disk is full.

verification.payload:
tree 3aeeed2359e4d2506aceb8e7ec5d2ced435cccae
parent 1973257da0501169f9d1e1eb5c0896ac25b471f9
author Ben Woosley <ben.woosley@gmail.com> 1546887388 -0800
committer Ben Woosley <ben.woosley@gmail.com> 1547029619 -0800

Fail if either disk space check fails

Rather than both.

Introduced in 386a6b62a8a1db9dd0f354cb95b7585f555c7e5d

events.message:
Fail if either disk space check fails

Rather than both.

Introduced in 386a6b62a8a1db9dd0f354cb95b7585f555c7e5d

events.body: Could add a test, if possible somehow?
I don't know of any way to set up the scenario as-is - could refactor for more testability with stubbing/mocking.

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -1631,7 +1631,7 @@ bool AppInitMain(InitInterfaces& interfaces)
 
     // ********************************************************* Step 11: import blocks
 
-    if (!CheckDiskSpace() && !CheckDiskSpace(0, true))
+    if (!CheckDiskSpace() || !CheckDiskSpace(0, true))
comments.body: Could use named arguments for literals?

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -1631,7 +1631,7 @@ bool AppInitMain(InitInterfaces& interfaces)
 
     // ********************************************************* Step 11: import blocks
 
-    if (!CheckDiskSpace() && !CheckDiskSpace(0, true))
+    if (!CheckDiskSpace() || !CheckDiskSpace(0, true))
comments.body: Done. #15118 clarifies these more so I'm partly deferring to that.

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -1631,7 +1631,7 @@ bool AppInitMain(InitInterfaces& interfaces)
 
     // ********************************************************* Step 11: import blocks
 
-    if (!CheckDiskSpace() && !CheckDiskSpace(0, true))
+    if (!CheckDiskSpace() || !CheckDiskSpace(/* additional_bytes */ 0, /* blocks_dir */ true))
comments.body: When you are changing this anyway: please provide explicit arguments to the first call too, instead of relying on default arguments
